chunks.text: ### BN(O) Status Holder route
chunks.summary: The BN(O) Status Holder route applies to BN(O) visa holders seeking immigration to the UK. It requires holders to meet specific eligibility criteria and follow designated application processes. Critical conditions include maintaining valid BN(O) status and fulfilling any specified health or character requirements.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for Status Holder route

HK 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Status Holder must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| Applicants with a chipped passport who: • hold a passport which shows they are registered as a British National (Overseas); or • hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. | Either: • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa using the UK Immigration: ID Check app (when available); or • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |
| Other applicants | Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |

1.   HK 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Status Holder must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality.

HK 1.3. The applicant must be aged 18 years or over on the date of application.

HK 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a BN(O) Status Holder may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Status Holder must apply online using the specified form, meet fee and biometrics requirements, and provide valid travel documentation. Applicants must be at least 18 years old, and applications failing to meet these criteria will be rejected.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for BN(O) Status Holder

HK 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   HK 2.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail, except where they have been placed on immigration bail after making an asylum claim in the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Status Holders applying for permission to stay. They must not breach immigration laws or be on immigration bail, with certain overstaying exceptions. Compliance with suitability requirements is essential for approval.

chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Status Holders seeking immigration benefits. It requires they meet specified eligibility criteria, including past residence and conduct standards; exceptions may exist based on criminal record or certain breaches.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for BN(O) Status Holder

HK 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a BN(O) Status Holder must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a BN(O) Status Holder before they arrive in the UK.

HK 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a BN(O) Status Holder must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: BN(O) Status Holders applying to enter the UK must secure entry clearance beforehand; if relevant, they must also provide a TB screening certificate confirming they do not have active pulmonary tuberculosis.

### BN(O) Status holder requirement

HK 4.1. The applicant must be a British National (Overseas) under the Hong Kong (British Nationality) Order 1986.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) status holders applying for immigration under HK 4.1. They must hold BN(O) nationality as defined by the Hong Kong (British Nationality) Order 1986. No additional conditions or exceptions are specified in this section.

metadata.section_title: Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

HK 5.1. An applicant applying for entry clearance must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong at the date of application.

HK 5.2. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK, and must be ordinarily resident in the UK, the Bailiwick of Guernsey, Bailiwick of Jersey, the Isle of Man or Hong Kong on the date of application.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Status Holders seeking entry clearance or permission to stay. Applicants must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong (for entry clearance) or in the UK, Bailiwick of Guernsey, Jersey, Isle of Man, or Hong Kong (for permission to stay) at the date of application. No exceptions are specified.

metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

HK 6.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement unless the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route.

HK 6.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, or where the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route, the decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant can adequately maintain and accommodate themselves without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months.

1.   HK 6.3. For the purposes of HK 6.2. accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if: 
    1.   (a) it is, or will be, overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 6.4. The applicant may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 6.5. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: The provision applies to BN(O) Status Holders applying for permission to stay or entry clearance. It requires evidence of financial ability to support and house oneself without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months, with conditions based on duration of UK residence and previous grants; accommodation must be adequate, and third-party support may be relied upon.

metadata.section_title: In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

1.   HK 7.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and: 
    1.   (a) their last grant of permission was for 6 months or less; and
    2.   (b) the applicant was present in a country listed in Appendix Tuberculosis (TB) of these rules for more than six months immediately prior to their last grant of permission,

2.   the applicant must provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

HK 7.2. In HK 7.1. a valid medical certificate is a certificate from an approved centre issued within the 6 months immediately before the date of application.

HK 7.3. The in-country tuberculosis requirement is met if the applicant provided a medical certificate described in HK 7.1. as part of a successful application for entry clearance in the 12 months before the date of application.

HK 7.4. The list of approved centres in the UK, updated from time to time, can be found at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno.
chunks.summary: BN(O) Status Holders applying to stay in the UK must provide a recent (within 6 months) medical certificate confirming no active tuberculosis if they previously stayed in a listed country for over six months and their last permission was 6 months or less. This requirement is met if such certification was provided within the past 12 months through an approved health centre.

This requirement is met if such certification was provided within the past 12 months through an approved health centre.

### In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for BN(O) Status Holder

1.   HK 7.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and: 
    1.   (a) their last grant of permission was for 6 months or less; and
    2.   (b) the applicant was present in a country listed in Appendix Tuberculosis (TB) of these rules for more than six months immediately prior to their last grant of permission,

2.   the applicant must provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

HK 7.2. In HK 7.1. a valid medical certificate is a certificate from an approved centre issued within the 6 months immediately before the date of application.

HK 7.3. The in-country tuberculosis requirement is met if the applicant provided a medical certificate described in HK 7.1. as part of a successful application for entry clearance in the 12 months before the date of application.

HK 7.4. The list of approved centres in the UK, updated from time to time, can be found at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a BN(O) Status Holder

HK 8.1. If the decision-maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a BN(O) Status Holder are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

HK 8.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Status Holder applicants, requiring them to satisfy all suitability and eligibility criteria for approval. If these are met, the application is granted; if not, it is refused, with the option to request an Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a BN(O) Status Holder

1.   HK 9.1. The applicant will be granted permission for either: 
    1.   (a) a period of 5 years, where the applicant has applied for a period of 5 years; or
    2.   (b) a period of 30 months (plus, where the applicant has extant permission on the Hong Kong BN(O) route, the remaining period of that permission, up to a maximum of 28 days) where the applicant has applied for a period of 30 months.
chunks.summary: BN(O) Status Holders are eligible for a grant of either 5 years or 30 months, depending on their application. The 30-month grant includes any remaining existing permission up to 28 days; no other conditions are specified.

metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a BN(O) Status Holder

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a BN(O) Status Holder

1.   HK 9.2. The permission will be granted subject to the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted except for employment as a professional sportsperson (including as a sports coach); and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Status Holders. They must not access public funds, can work or study (with an ATAS condition for study), but cannot work as professional sportspeople or coaches. These conditions are mandatory for the grant of their permission.

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 10.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| Applicants with a chipped passport who: - hold a passport which shows they are registered as a British National (Overseas); or - hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; or - are EEA nationals. | Either: • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa using the UK Immigration: ID Check app (when available); or • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |
| Other applicants | Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |

1.   HK 10.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route must meet all the following validity requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) when applying as a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route, where the applicant does not currently hold, or did not last hold, permission as a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route the applicant must be applying as a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay in the UK as a BN(O) Status Holder that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission as a BN(O) status holder; or
        3.   (iii) is both a British citizen and a BN(O) status holder.

    5.   (e) when applying as a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route on the basis of being a child of a BN(O) Status Holder or of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder, the applicant must be applying as a child of a BN(O) Status Holder or of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay in the UK as a BN(O) Status Holder or as the partner of a BN(O) status Holder that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission as a BN(O) Status Holder or as the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder; or
        3.   (iii)is both a British citizen and a BN(O) status holder; and

    6.   (f) when applying as a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) status holder route on the basis of being a grandchild of a BN(O) Status Holder or of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder, the applicant must apply at the same time as the BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 10.3. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or BN(O) Household child on the BN(O) Status Holder route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry or stay as a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) route must apply online using specified forms and meet requirements including paying fees, providing biometrics, submitting valid travel documents, and satisfying nationality and identity conditions. All conditions must be met unless a fee waiver is granted; certain applicants with specific passports may use alternative application methods.

| Other applicants | Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |

1.   HK 10.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route must meet all the following validity requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and

    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) when applying as a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route, where the applicant does not currently hold, or did not last hold, permission as a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route the applicant must be applying as a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay in the UK as a BN(O) Status Holder that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission as a BN(O) status holder; or
        3.   (iii) is both a British citizen and a BN(O) status holder.

    5.   (e) when applying as a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route on the basis of being a child of a BN(O) Status Holder or of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder, the applicant must be applying as a child of a BN(O) Status Holder or of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay in the UK as a BN(O) Status Holder or as the partner of a BN(O) status Holder that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission as a BN(O) Status Holder or as the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder; or
        3.   (iii)is both a British citizen and a BN(O) status holder; and

    6.   (f) when applying as a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) status holder route on the basis of being a grandchild of a BN(O) Status Holder or of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder, the applicant must apply at the same time as the BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 10.3. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or BN(O) Household child on the BN(O) Status Holder route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the Hong Kong BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the Hong Kong BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 11.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   HK 11.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail, except where they have been placed on such bail after making an asylum claim in the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and BN(O) Household Children applying under the Hong Kong BN(O) route. They must be suitable under Part Suitability, meaning they cannot breach immigration laws or be on immigration bail (except in specific overstaying cases).

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for a partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 12.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a partner or BN(O) Household child on the BN(O) Status Holder route must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a partner or BN(O) Household child before they arrive in the UK.

HK 12.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the BN(O) Status Holder route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry as a partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route must apply for and obtain entry clearance before arriving in the UK. They must also provide a TB medical certificate if tuberculosis screening is required.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for dependent partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for dependent partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 13.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and they have permission as a dependent partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route on the date of application, they will meet the relationship requirement.

HK 13.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance or permission to stay and they have not previously had permission as a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route they must meet the relationship requirement in HK 13.3. to HK 13.7.

1.   HK 13.3. The applicant must be the partner of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P has entry clearance or permission on the Hong Kong BN(O) route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or permission on the Hong Kong BN(O) route; or
    3.   (c) P has settlement under the Hong Kong BN(O) Route and when they obtained settlement, the applicant had permission as P’s partner at that time; or
    4.   (d) P is both a British citizen and a BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 13.4. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

HK 13.5. DELETED.

HK 13.6. DELETED.

HK 13.7. DELETED.

HK 13.8. DELETED.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for dependent partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for dependent partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 14.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement unless the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route.

HK 14.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, or where the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route, the decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant or the BN(O) Status Holder are able to maintain and accommodate the applicant adequately in the UK without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months.

1.   HK 14.3. For the purposes of HK 14.2. accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if: 
    1.   (a) it is, or will be, overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 14.4. The applicant or the BN(O) Status Holder may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 14.5. The applicant or the BN(O) Status Holder must show that they have the required funds as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners applying under the BN(O) route must demonstrate they can maintain and accommodate themselves in the UK without public funds, either after 12 months of residence or, if less than 12 months, with credible third-party support, abiding by accommodation and financial thresholds.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

1.   HK 15.1. The applicant must be: 
    1.   (a) the child of a parent who: 
        1.   (i) has, or is at the same time being granted, entry clearance or permission as either a BN(O) Status Holder or the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder; or
        2.   (ii) has settlement under the Hong Kong BN(O) route and when they obtained settlement the applicant had permission as their dependent child; or
        3.   (iii) is both a British citizen and a BN(O) Status Holder; or

    2.   (b) The grandchild of a grandparent who: 
        1.   (i) has, or is at the same time being granted, entry clearance or permission as either a BN(O) Status Holder or the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder; or
        2.   (ii) has settlement under the Hong Kong BN(O) route and when they obtained settlement the applicant had permission as their dependent grandchild; or
        3.   (iii) is both a British citizen and a BN(O) Status Holder.

2.   HK 15.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as the grandchild of a BN(O) Status Holder or the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder and the applicant has not previously had permission as a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route: 
    1.   (a) they must form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder on the date of application; and
    2.   (b) the BN(O) Status Holder must have, or at the same time be being granted, entry clearance or permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route.

HK 15.3. In HK 15.2(a) a person will form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder if they normally live with the BN(O) Status Holder.

1.   HK 15.4. Each of the applicant’s parents must either be applying at the same time as the applicant, or have permission to be in the UK (other than as a Visitor), unless: 
    1.   (a) the parent with entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Status Holder or as a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder is the sole surviving parent; or
    2.   (b) the parent with entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Status Holder or as a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder has sole responsibility for the applicant’s upbringing; or
    3.   (c) the parent who does not have permission as a BN(O) Status Holder or as a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder – 
        1.   (i) is a British citizen or a person who has a right to enter or stay in the UK without restriction; and
        2.   (ii) is or will be ordinarily resident in the UK; or

    4.   (d) there are serious and compelling reasons to grant the applicant entry clearance or permission to stay with the parent who has permission on the Hong Kong BN(O) route; or
    5.   (e) the applicant falls within HK 15.1(b) and there are serious and compelling reasons to grant the applicant entry clearance or permission to stay with the grandparent with entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Status Holder or as a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 15.5. If the applicant is a child born in the UK to a BN(O) Status Holder or their partner, the applicant must provide a full UK birth certificate showing the names of both parents.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Household Children and Grandchildren seeking entry or permission to stay under the BN(O) status route. It requires the applicant to be the child or grandchild of a BN(O) Status Holder or partner, with specific household and permission history conditions if not previously granted BN(O) household status. Critical conditions include forming part of the same household at application and the status of the parent or grandparent.

metadata.section_title: Care requirement for a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Care requirement for a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 16.1. The applicant must intend to live with a parent who has permission on the BN(O) status holder route during their stay in the UK, unless they can demonstrate a valid reason why they should not live with that parent.

HK 16.2. The applicant must meet the Care Requirement for a dependent child in Appendix Children.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying under the BN(O) Status Holder route for a household child must intend to live with a parent holding BN(O) status in the UK, unless a valid reason exists. Additionally, they must satisfy the Care Requirement outlined in Appendix Children.

### Age requirement for a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 17.1. The applicant must be under the age of 18 at the date of application.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for a BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 18.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement.

HK 18.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, the decision maker must be satisfied that the BN(O) Status Holder or their partner is able to maintain and accommodate the BN(O) Household Child adequately in the UK without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months.

1.   HK 18.3. For the purposes of HK 18.2 accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if 
    1.   (a) it is or will be overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 18.4. The BN(O) Status Holder or their partner may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 18.5. The BN(O) Status Holder or their partner must show that they have the required funds as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking permission to stay or entry clearance must demonstrate adequate financial support for a BN(O) Household Child, either by having lived in the UK for 12+ months or proof of sufficient resources to maintain and accommodate the child without public funds for at least 6 months; accommodation must be non-overcrowded and compliant with health regulations.

metadata.section_title: Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 19.1. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance as a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child, the applicant must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong at the date of application.

HK 19.2. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK and must be ordinarily resident in the UK, the Bailiwick of Guernsey, Bailiwick of Jersey, the Isle of Man or Hong Kong on the date of application.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry clearance as a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong at the application date. For permission to stay, they must be in the UK or specified Crown dependencies and normally resident there or in Hong Kong at the time of application.

### Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

HK 19.1. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance as a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child, the applicant must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong at the date of application.

HK 19.2. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK and must be ordinarily resident in the UK, the Bailiwick of Guernsey, Bailiwick of Jersey, the Isle of Man or Hong Kong on the date of application.

metadata.section_title: In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

1.   HK 20.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and: 
    1.   (a) their last grant of permission was for 6 months or less; and
    2.   (b) the applicant was present in a country listed in Appendix Tuberculosis (TB). of these rules for more than six months immediately prior to their last grant of permission,

2.   the applicant must provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

HK 20.2. In HK 20.1. a valid medical certificate is a certificate from an approved centre issued within the 6 months immediately before the date of application.

HK 20.3. The in-country tuberculosis requirement is met if the applicant has provided a medical certificate described in HK 20.1. as part of a successful application for entry clearance in the 12 months before the date of application.

HK 20.4. The list of approved centres in the UK, updated from time to time, can be found at: [https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno).
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and BN(O) Household Children applying for permission to stay under the BN(O) route. They must provide a recent medical certificate showing they have undergone TB screening, if their last permission was for 6 months or less and they resided in listed countries for over six months before the last grant. The certificate must be from an approved centre and issued within six months prior to application.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder Route

HK 21.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route are met the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

HK 21.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

It requires the decision-maker to assess all suitability and eligibility criteria; failure to meet these leads to refusal, with the option for an Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a dependent partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

1.   HK 22.1. The partner will be granted permission for either: 
    1.   (a) a period of 30 months (plus, where the partner has extant permission on the Hong Kong BN(O) route, the remaining period of that permission, up to a maximum of 28 days) where they have applied for a period of 30 months; or
    2.   (b) 5 years, if they applied for a period of 5 years.

HK 22.2. DELETED.

HK 22.3. DELETED.

1.   HK 22.4. A BN(O) Household Child will be granted either: 
    1.   (a) where the BN(O) Household Child is applying as the dependant of one parent or grandparent with permission as a BN(O) Status Holder or the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder, permission that ends on the same date as that parent or grandparent; or
    2.   (b) where the BN(O) Household Child is applying as the dependant of both parents or grandparents with permission as a BN(O) Status Holder or the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder, permission that ends on the same date as those parents or grandparents or, if different, the same date as the parent or grandparent whose permission ends latest.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents (partners and household children) of BN(O) Status Holders. Partners can receive permission for either 30 months or 5 years, depending on their application, while BN(O) household children’s permission aligns with that of their parent(s) or grandparent(s). Conditions include matching expiry dates with the primary permit holder’s permission.

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a partner or BN(O) Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route

1.   HK 22.5. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted except for employment as a professional sportsperson (including as a sports coach); and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    4.   (d) DELETED.

chunks.text: ### BN(O) Household Member route
chunks.summary: The BN(O) Household Member route applies to family members of BN(O) visa holders. Applicants must meet eligibility and relationship criteria, and must not have been previously refused or removed from the UK; specific conditions or exceptions are outlined in the rules.

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for the BN(O) Household Member route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for the BN(O) Household Member route

HK 23.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on the BN(O) Household Member route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| Applicants with a chipped passport who: - hold a passport which shows they are registered as a British National (Overseas); or - hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; or - are EEA nationals. | Either: • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa using the UK Immigration: ID Check app (when available); or • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |
| Other applicants | Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |

1.   HK 23.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the BN(O) Household Member route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) when applying for the first time as a BN(O) Household Member, if the applicant is applying as a child of the partner of a BN(O) Status Holder and does not have, or did not last hold, permission as a Household Child on the BN(O) Status Holder route, the applicant must apply for entry clearance or permission to stay in the UK at the same time as the BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 23.3. The applicant must have been born on or after 1 July 1997.

HK 23.4. The applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

HK 23.5. The applicant must not have or have last had permission as a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the BN(O) Status Holder route.

HK 23.6. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for the BN(O) Household Member route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking entry clearance or permission to stay on the BN(O) Household Member route. They must apply online using the specified form and meet requirements including paying fees, providing biometrics, submitting valid travel documents, and, for first-time applications as a Household Member, demonstrating appropriate relationship status. Critical conditions include fee payment and biometric submission, with exceptions for fee waivers.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for the BN(O) Household Member route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for the BN(O) Household Member route

HK 24.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   HK 24.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail, except where they have been placed on such bail after making an asylum claim in the UK.
chunks.summary: The provision applies to BN(O) household applicants seeking permission to stay. They must not be in breach of immigration laws or on immigration bail, with specific exceptions for overstayers and asylum-related bail.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

HK 25.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the BN(O) Household Member route must apply for and obtain entry clearance on the BN(O) Household Member route before they arrive in the UK.

HK 25.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a BN(O) Household member must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

HK 26.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and they have permission on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route on the date of application, they will meet the relationship requirement.

1.   HK 26.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance or permission to stay and they do not have permission on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route on the date of application, the applicant: 
    1.   (a) must be the child of a person who is, or who was prior to their death, a British National (Overseas) under the Hong Kong (British Nationality) Order 1986; or
    2.   (b) must be the child of a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder: 
        1.   (i) who forms part of the same household as the BN(O) Status holder; and
        2.   (ii) the BN(O) Status Holder must have, or at the same time be being granted, entry clearance or permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route.

HK 26.3. In HK 26.2. a person will form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder if they normally live with the BN(O) Status Holder.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) household members applying for permission to stay or entry clearance. They must either already have permission via the BN(O) route or be the child of a BN(O) or a partner living in the same household with a BN(O) Status Holder. Critical conditions include familial or household relationships and the timing of permission grants.

    1.   (a) must be the child of a person who is, or who was prior to their death, a British National (Overseas) under the Hong Kong (British Nationality) Order 1986; or
    2.   (b) must be the child of a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder: 
        1.   (i) who forms part of the same household as the BN(O) Status holder; and

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

HK 27.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement unless the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route.

HK 27.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and they have been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, or where the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route, the decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant, or a person who has or is being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route, is able to, and will, maintain and accommodate the applicant adequately in the UK without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months.

1.   HK 27.3. For the purposes of HK 27.2 accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if: 
    1.   (a) it is or will be overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 27.4. The applicant or the person on the BN(O) Status Holder route may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 27.5. The applicant or the person on the BN(O) Status Holder route must show that they have the required funds as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Household Members applying to stay or enter the UK. Applicants who have been in the UK for 12+ months are deemed to meet the financial requirement, unless their prior permission was for 12 months outside the Rules after an unsuccessful route application. Those with less than 12 months’ residence or previous adverse permission must demonstrate adequate maintenance and accommodation without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months, excluding overcrowded or health-violating premises.

metadata.section_title: Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

HK 28.1. An applicant applying for entry clearance as a BN(O) Household Member must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong on the date of application.

HK 28.2. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK and must be ordinarily resident in the UK, the Bailiwick of Guernsey, Bailiwick of Jersey, the Isle of Man or Hong Kong.

metadata.section_title: In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### In-country tuberculosis certificate requirement for a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 29.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and: 
    1.   (a) their last grant of permission was for 6 months or less; and
    2.   (b) the applicant was present in a country listed in Appendix Tuberculosis of these rules for more than six months immediately prior to their last grant of permission,

2.   the applicant must provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

HK 29.2. In HK 29.1. a valid medical certificate is a certificate from an approved centre issued within the 6 months immediately before the date of application.

HK 29.3. The in-country tuberculosis certificate requirement is met if the applicant has provided a medical certificate described in HK 29.1. as part of a successful application for entry clearance in the 12 months before the date of application.

HK 29.4. The list of approved centres in the UK, updated from time to time, can be found at: [https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno).
chunks.summary: BN(O) household members applying to stay must provide a recent (within 6 months) medical certificate confirming they tested negative for active tuberculosis if they previously stayed in a listed country for over six months and their last permission was for six months or less; this requirement can also be satisfied by a valid certificate from an approved UK clinic obtained within the past 12 months.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a BN(O) Household Member

HK 30.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements on the BN(O) Household Member route are met the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

HK 30.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Household Members applying for immigration. The key requirement is that all suitability and eligibility criteria are met for approval; otherwise, the application is refused, but applicants may request an Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 31.1. If the applicant is applying as the child of a BN(O) Status Holder or they already have permission on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route on the date of application, they will be granted permission for either: 
    1.   a) a period of 5 years, where the applicant has applied for a period of 5 years; or
    2.   b) a period of 30 months (plus, where the applicant has remaining permission under the Hong Kong BN(O) route, the remaining period of that permission, up to a maximum of 28 days) where the applicant has applied for a period of 30 months.

HK 31.2. If the applicant does not have permission on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route on the date of application and is the child of a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route, the applicant will be granted permission which ends on the same date as the BN(O) Status Holder.
chunks.summary: BN(O) Household Members who are children or partners of BN(O) status holders may receive 5-year or 30-month permission if applying as children, or permission ending with the BN(O) status holder if not. Conditions depend on their relationship and existing permissions, with specific maximum durations.

metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 31.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted except for employment as a professional sportsperson, including as a sports coach; and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the condition in Appendix ATAS.
    4.   (d) DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) Household Members granted immigration status. They must not access public funds, may work (excluding professional sports), and can study (with ATAS conditions). Access to employment as a professional sportsperson is prohibited.

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a BN(O) Household Member on the Hong Kong BN(O) route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a BN(O) Household Member on the Hong Kong BN(O) route

HK 32.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child on the BN(O) Household Member route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| Applicants with a chipped passport who: - hold a passport which shows they are registered as a British National (Overseas); or - hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; or - are EEA nationals. | Either: • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa using the UK Immigration: ID Check app (when available); or • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |
| Other applicants | Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |

1.   HK 32.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child on the BN(O) Household Member route must meet the following validity requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) when applying on the BN(O) Household Member route as a partner or child of a person who is the child of a BN(O) Status Holder and where the applicant does not currently hold, or did not last hold, permission on the BN(O) Household Member route, the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay in the UK as a BN(O) Household Member that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission as a BN(O) Household Member

    5.   (e) when applying on the BN(O) Household Member as a partner or child of a person who is the child of a partner of a BN(O) Status Holder and where the applicant does not currently hold, or did not last hold, permission on the BN(O) Household Member route, the applicant must apply at the same time as the BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 32.3. DELETED

HK 32.4. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the BN(O) Household Member route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking to join or stay as dependents of a BN(O) Household Member must apply online using specified forms, paying fees, providing biometrics, and submitting valid travel documents that confirm their identity and nationality. These requirements apply to all applicants, with specific forms for certain passport types, ensuring they meet the UK's immigration validity standards.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or child on the BN(O) Household Member route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or child on the BN(O) Household Member route

HK 33.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   HK 33.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail, except where they have been placed on such bail after making an asylum claim in the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and children on the BN(O) Household Member route. They must not breach immigration laws or be on immigration bail (unless related to asylum), ensuring their suitability for permission to stay under UK immigration rules.

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for a partner or child on the BN(O) Household Member route

HK 34.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a partner or child on the BN(O) Household Member route must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a partner or child before they arrive in the UK.

HK 34.2. A person applying for entry clearance as the partner or child a BN(O) Household member must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry as a partner or child on the BN(O) Household Member route must obtain prior entry clearance, including TB screening if applicable, before arriving in the UK.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements for dependent partner of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements for dependent partner of a BN(O) Household Member

HK 35.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and they have permission as a partner on the BN(O) Household Member route on the date of application, they will meet the relationship requirements.

HK 35.2. Where the applicant is applying for entry clearance or permission to stay and they have not previously had permission on the BN(O) Household Member route they must meet the relationship requirement as set out in HK 35.3. to HK 35.9.

1.   HK 35.3. The applicant must be the partner of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P has permission on the BN(O) Household Member route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or permission on the BN(O) Household Member route; or
    3.   (c) P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the BN(O) Household Member route when they settled and the applicant had permission as P’s partner at that time.

HK 35.4. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met .

HK 35.5. DELETED.

HK 35.6. DELETED.

1.   HK 35.7. Where P is the child of a partner on the BN(O) Status Holder route: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder on the date of application; and
    2.   (b) the BN(O) Status Holder must have, or at the same time be being granted, entry clearance or permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route.

HK 35.8. In HK 35.7(a) a person will form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder if they normally live with the BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 35.9. DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents applying for permission to stay as partners of BN(O) Household Members. Applicants must demonstrate a genuine partner relationship with someone on the BN(O) route, meeting specified connection criteria; those already granted BN(O) permission or with settled status are exempt. Additionally, partners of BN(O) status holders or their children must satisfy household and relationship conditions.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for partner of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for partner of a BN(O) Household Member

HK 36.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement unless the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route.

HK 36.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, or where the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route, the decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant, the BN(O) Household Member or a person being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route is able to maintain and accommodate the applicant adequately in the UK without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months.

1.   HK 36.3 For the purposes of HK 36.2. accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if 
    1.   (a) it is or will be overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 36.4. The applicant, the BN(O) Household Member or a person being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 36.5. The applicant, the BN(O) Household Member or a person being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route must show that they have the required funds as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners of BN(O) Household Members seeking permission to stay in the UK. Applicants must meet financial requirements, either by demonstrating ongoing residence of 12 months with permission or, if less than 12 months, by showing they can be maintained and accommodated without public funds for at least 6 months. Exceptions include previous grants for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules after unsuccessful BN(O) route applications, and credible third-party support can be relied upon.

### Financial requirement for partner of a BN(O) Household Member

HK 36.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement unless the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route.

HK 36.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, or where the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route, the decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant, the BN(O) Household Member or a person being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route is able to maintain and accommodate the applicant adequately in the UK without recourse to public funds for at least 6 months.

1.   HK 36.3 For the purposes of HK 36.2. accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if 
    1.   (a) it is or will be overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 36.4. The applicant, the BN(O) Household Member or a person being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 36.5. The applicant, the BN(O) Household Member or a person being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route must show that they have the required funds as specified in Appendix Finance.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for dependent child of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for dependent child of a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 37.1. The applicant must be the child of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P has permission on the BN(O) Household Member route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or permission on the BN(O) Household Member route; or
    3.   (c) P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the BN(O) Household Member route when they settled, and the applicant had permission as P’s child at that time.

1.   HK 37.2. Where neither parent of the applicant is the child of a BN(O) status holder and the applicant has not previously been granted entry clearance or permission as a child on the BN(O) Household Member route: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder on the date of application; and
    2.   (b) the BN(O) Status Holder must have, or at the same time be being granted, entry clearance or permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route.

HK 37.3. In HK 37.2(a) a person will form part of the same household as the BN(O) Status Holder if they normally live with the BN(O) Status Holder.

HK 37.4. If the applicant is a child born in the UK to a BN(O) Household Member or their partner, the applicant must provide a full UK birth certificate showing the names of both parents.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent children of BN(O) Household Members seeking entry or settlement. The key requirement is that the applicant must be related as a child to someone with permission or settlement under the BN(O) route, or live in the same household as such a person if they haven't previously been granted BN(O) status. Critical conditions include proof of relationship, household proximity, and specific eligibility when born in the UK.

metadata.section_title: Care requirement for a dependent child of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Care requirement for a dependent child of a BN(O) Household Member

HK 38.1. The applicant must intend to live with a parent who has permission on the BN(O) Household Member route during their stay in the UK, unless they can demonstrate a valid reason why they should not live with that parent.

HK 38.2. The applicant must meet the Care Requirement for a dependent child in Appendix Children.

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for child of a BN(O) Household Member

HK 40.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK for 12 months or more on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement unless the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route.

HK 40.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK with permission for less than 12 months on the date of application, or where the applicant’s previous grant of permission was for 12 months Leave Outside the Rules following an unsuccessful application for the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route, the decision maker must be satisfied that the BN(O) Household Member, their partner or a person who is being granted permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route is able to and will maintain and accommodate the applicant adequately in the UK without recourse to public funds for at least six months.

1.   HK 40.3. For the purposes of HK 40.2. accommodation will not be regarded as adequate if 
    1.   (a) it is or will be overcrowded; or
    2.   (b) it contravenes public health regulations.

HK 40.4. The BN(O) Household Member, their partner or a person with permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route may rely on credible promises of future third party support.

HK 40.5. The BN(O) Household Member, their partner or a person with permission on the BN(O) Status Holder route must show that they have the required funds as specified in Appendix Finance.

The key requirement is that applicants or their sponsors must demonstrate adequate maintenance and accommodation in the UK for at least six months unless they have lived in the UK for 12 months or more, in which case the financial requirement is deemed met. Conditions include restrictions based on previous immigration history, accommodation standards, and reliance on credible third-party support.

metadata.section_title: Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Ordinary residence in Hong Kong requirement for partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

HK 41.1. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance as a dependent partner or child the applicant must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong at the date of application.

HK 41.2. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK and must be ordinarily resident in the UK, the Bailiwick of Guernsey, Bailiwick of Jersey, the Isle of Man or Hong Kong on the date of application.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents of BN(O) Household Members applying for entry clearance or permission to stay. Applicants must be ordinarily resident in Hong Kong (for entry clearance) or in the UK or specified Crown dependencies (for permission to stay) on the application date. No exceptions or thresholds are specified.

metadata.section_title: In-country tuberculosis requirement for partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### In-country tuberculosis requirement for partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 42.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and: 
    1.   (a) their last grant of permission was for 6 months or less;
    2.   (b) the applicant was present in a country listed in Appendix Tuberculosis of these rules for more than six months immediately prior to their last grant of permission,

2.   the applicant must provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

HK 42.2. In HK 42.1. a valid medical certificate is a certificate from an approved centre issued within the 6 months immediately before the date of application.

HK 42.3. The in-country tuberculosis requirement is met if the applicant provided a medical certificate described in HK 42.1. as part of a successful application for entry clearance in the 12 months before the date of application.

HK 42.4. The list of approved centres in the UK, updated from time to time, can be found at: [https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-tuberculosis-test-clinics-for-hong-kong-bno).
chunks.summary: Applicants who last had permission for 6 months or less and were in a listed country for over six months must provide a recent (within 6 months) approved medical certificate confirming they do not have active tuberculosis. This requirement applies to partners or children of BN(O) Household Members seeking permission to stay, with certificates valid for up to 12 months prior to application.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member on the Hong Kong BN(O) route

HK 43.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the dependent partner or dependent child on the BN(O) Household Member route are met the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

HK 43.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

The decision-maker grants the application if all suitability and eligibility requirements are met; otherwise, it is refused, with applicants able to request an Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a dependent partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a dependent partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 44.1. The partner will be granted permission for either: 
    1.   (a) a period of 30 months (plus, where the partner has extant permission on the Hong Kong BN(O) route, the remaining period of that permission, up to a maximum of 28 days) where they have applied for a period of 30 months; or
    2.   (b) 5 years, if they applied for a period of 5 years.

1.   HK 44.2. DELETED.

HK 44.3. DELETED.

1.   HK 44.4. A child on the BN(O) Household Member route will be granted either: 
    1.   (a) where the child is applying as the dependant of one parent with permission as a BN(O) Household Member or the partner of a BN(O) Household Member, permission that ends on the same date as that parent; or
    2.   (b) where the child is applying as the dependant of both parents with permission on the BN(O) Household Member route, permission that ends on the same date as those parents or, if different, the same date as the parent whose permission ends latest.
chunks.summary: Dependents of BN(O) Household Members—partners and children—are eligible for grants of 30 months or 5 years, based on their application. Permissions for children end concurrently with or after their parent(s) on the BN(O) route; partners receive up to 30 months, depending on their application.

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a partner or child of a BN(O) Household Member

1.   HK 44.5. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted except for employment as a professional sportsperson (including as a sports coach); and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    4.   (d) DELETED.

chunks.summary: This provision applies to adult dependent relatives seeking entry under the Hong Kong BN(O) route. It requires demonstrating genuine dependency and deserving their claim, with specific criteria for illness, age, or care needs, and exceptions for less serious conditions.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Hong Kong British National (Overseas)
metadata.section_title: Validity Requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependant Relative

chunks.text:
### Validity Requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependant Relative

HK 45.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Adult Dependant Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| Applicants with a chipped passport who: - hold a passport which shows they are registered as a British National (Overseas); or - hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; or - are EEA nationals. | Either: • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa using the UK Immigration: ID Check app (when available); or • Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |
| Other applicants | Hong Kong British National (Overseas) Visa |

1.   HK 45.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route must meet all the following validity requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality.

HK 45.3. The applicant must be aged 18 years or over on the date of application.

1.   HK 45.4. The applicant must be the parent, grandparent, brother, sister, son or daughter of a person who is: 
    1.   (a) a BN(O) status holder who has entry clearance or permission to stay under the BN(O) Status Holder route or who has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or;
    2.   (b) the dependent partner (“DP”) of a BN(O) Status Holder, where the DP has entry clearance or permission to stay under the BN(O) Status Holder route or has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or
    3.   (c) the child of a BN(O) status holder who has entry clearance or permission to stay under the BN(O) Household Member route or who has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or
    4.   (d) the dependent partner (“DP”) of a child of a BN(O) status holder, where the DP has entry clearance or permission under the BN(O) Household Member route or has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or
    5.   (e) both a British citizen and a BN(O) status holder.

HK 45.5. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants aged 18 or over applying as BN(O) Adult Dependant Relatives must submit online applications using specific forms, pay applicable fees, provide biometrics, and submit valid travel documents. Critical conditions include meeting identity, nationality, and age requirements, with certain form options based on passport type.

1.   HK 45.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route must meet all the following validity requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid, unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality.

HK 45.3. The applicant must be aged 18 years or over on the date of application.

1.   HK 45.4. The applicant must be the parent, grandparent, brother, sister, son or daughter of a person who is: 
    1.   (a) a BN(O) status holder who has entry clearance or permission to stay under the BN(O) Status Holder route or who has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or;
    2.   (b) the dependent partner (“DP”) of a BN(O) Status Holder, where the DP has entry clearance or permission to stay under the BN(O) Status Holder route or has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or
    3.   (c) the child of a BN(O) status holder who has entry clearance or permission to stay under the BN(O) Household Member route or who has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or
    4.   (d) the dependent partner (“DP”) of a child of a BN(O) status holder, where the DP has entry clearance or permission under the BN(O) Household Member route or has made a valid application for such entry clearance or permission to stay; or
    5.   (e) both a British citizen and a BN(O) status holder.

HK 45.5. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability Requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative

chunks.text:
### Suitability Requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative

HK 46.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   HK 46.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail, except where they have been placed on such bail after making an asylum claim in the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to BN(O) adult dependent relative applicants. They must meet suitability criteria, including not breaching immigration laws or being on bail (unless related to asylum), with exceptions for overstaying as specified.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative

HK 47.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a BN(O) Adult Dependant Relative before they arrive in the UK.

HK 47.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a BN(O) Adult Dependent Relative on the Hong Kong British National (Overseas) route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry to the UK as BN(O) Adult Dependent Relatives must obtain entry clearance beforehand, including a TB screening certificate if applicable; no post-arrival applications are permitted.
